publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Khočo (Dakianus)during T I D 130

seg.seg: Du hast ihn [scil. den Buddha] sieben Tage lang mit einem Śloka gepriesen.
For seven days you praised him [i.e. the Buddha] with a śloka.
I am skilled [about crossing] the Saṃsāra lake.
You are skilful as a boatman on the Ganges; I am zealous on the saṃsāra lake. Let [me] cross the stream with [your] boat on the Ganges [and] I will pull you out of the saṃsāra lake. (cf 487)

Du bist geschickt [als] Schiffer auf der Gaṅgā, ich bin auf dem Saṃsāra-See erfahren. Lass [du] auf der Gaṅgā das Schiff [wtl. mit dem Schiff] die Flut überschreiten, [so] werde ich dich aus dem Saṃsāra-See herausziehen.
You are skilled [as] a boatman on the Gaṅgā, I am experienced on the Saṃsāra-lake. [You] let the ship [lit. on the ship] cross the surge on the Gaṅgā, [then] I will pull you out of the Saṃsāra-lake.

p.note: The leaf is in portrait, not landscape format. However, just as with a poṭhī leaf, it is to be flipped horizontally, not vertically as with Old Uyghur or European style books.

list.item: a1 ssi muditsa no po wnolmī plāntaṣarme palskonta : a2 triśalñenta po wnolmet_s\ ārte tārka upekṣsa sā a3 ste ytāre poyś[i]ñ[a] tesa poyśi maskele : || a4 || sāsa lkālñe śaiṣṣene poyśintsy olpo mā ne_s_aṃ : a5 se wat\ wel[ñ]e k[ly]au[ṣ]alñe posa ś(p)ālmeṃ pelaikne : a6 se wat\ [n]o – – r[tsi]y· s[āṅktsa] – – (m)ā [ne]_s_aṃ : toṃ a7 we_s\ tarya – – – yärke [t·] – – [·ā]ske_m\ : || a8 || (a)[saṃ]khy(ai)nts[e] (trice)[p]i [ā]k[e](sa twe saṃci)te ñ[e]m [ṣ]ait [k]ā a9 lśke • p(a)ryariṣṣai sl[em](e)ntsa wanto_ś\ [wane] lyakāsta tiyśi[ṃ] : b1 mand\ tā pasi _m_arsasta pālataine ṣuko_mtsa ṣeme śloktsa • b2 ñu kalpaṣṣa lal[y]iye takā_ś\ ita wnāskau cau tsiromñe : || b3 || gāṅkne olyitau ne_s\ twe epastya • lyamne saṃntsārṣṣe ti b4 kṣne ñi_ś\ nesau : gāṅkne olyisa tseñe _k_a_t_k_aṣṣa_r\ • lya b5 mmeṃ santsārṣṣe ñi_ś\ ci salkama_r\ : || mpar tstanācce vai b6 deh\ śliye wane cau • ṣami mpolskoññe śakyamune b7 saim wasta saṅkamp= eṣe • lkātsi śemane ñikteṃsa b8 swe ylai-ñikteṃ śaci lāntsompa pañcaśikhi [k]wirapa b9 bhadramp= eṣe : || pā_t_a_r\ mā_t_a_r\ _k_aṣṣintat_s\ winā
The leaf is in portrait, not landscape format. However, just as with a poṭhī leaf, it is to be flipped horizontally, not vertically as with Old Uyghur or European style books.

Alternative classifications:
Peyrotlate
Malzahn–
TamaiIII-2 (1000-1100)
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
b3-5 You are skilful as a boatman on the Ganges; I am zealous on the saṃsāra lake. Let [me] cross the stream with [your] boat on the Ganges [and] I will pull you out of the saṃsāra lake. (cf [[Schmidt KT 1974]]: 487) 298

Lines Translation Pages
a1 Erfreue unsere Gedanken! 506
b1 Du hast ihn [scil. den Buddha] sieben Tage lang mit einem Śloka gepriesen. 172
b3-5 Du bist geschickt [als] Schiffer auf der Gaṅgā, ich bin auf dem Saṃsāra-See erfahren. Lass [du] auf der Gaṅgā das Schiff [wtl. mit dem Schiff] die Flut überschreiten, [so] werde ich dich aus dem Saṃsāra-See herausziehen. 487

a4: Ron Kim suggests o in olyo seems to have been accidentally omitted (MP: don't understand)
a9 Ron Kim suggests w[ane] instead of [wane] (MP: agree)
b8 Ron Kim suggests kwirapa instead of [k]wirapa (MP: agree)

b3 I am skilled [about crossing] the Saṃsāra lake.

a4: Ron Kim suggests o in olyo seems to have been accidentally omitted (MP: don't understand) a9 Ron Kim suggests w[ane] instead of [wane] (MP: agree) b8 Ron Kim suggests kwirapa instead of [k]wirapa (MP: agree)
